data.title: Christopher Newport University
data.meta_description: Mason Studer (35) Kicker/Punter  - 2013 - Junior - Excelled for the Captains and earned All-Conference and All-State honors as both a punter and kicker ... Secured
data.text:
2013 - Junior - Excelled for the Captains and earned All-Conference and All-State honors as both a punter and kicker ... Secured first-team All-USA South, second-team All-State, and third-team All-Region nods for his efforts as a kicker ... Also brought home second-team All-Conference and All-State accolades as a punter ... Finished the year a perfect 27-of-27 on extra-point attempts and led the USA South with a 79 percent success rate on field goals after converting 11 of his 14 attempts ... His 11 field goals placed him third on the program’s single-season list ... Finished third in the league among kickers with 60 total points ... Booted a pair of 42-yard field goals after connecting against Hampden-Sydney on September 14 and at Ferrum on November 16 ... Kicked a pair of field goals against Shenandoah on September 21, N.C. Wesleyan on October 12, and LaGrange on November 2 ... Was a perfect 6-for-6 on extra-point attempts at Greensboro on October 26 ... Averaged 38.8 yards per punt during the year, which ranked second in the conference ... Booted a season-best 59-yard punt against Hampden-Sydney, which marked the longest punt in the USA South during the year ... Had three other kicks of at least 50 yards, including a 52-yard bullet at Greensboro on October 26 ... Finished the year with 3,731 yards punting, which marked the fourth-highest single-season total in CNU history.

2012 - Sophomore – Appeared in all 11 games for the Captains…Received second-team All-Conference nods at both kicker and punter…Converted 8 of 13 field goals, including a season-best 47-yard boot against Methodist…Drilled a pair of field goals against LaGrange…Made 27 of his 33 field goal attempts...Went 6-for-6 at Maryville before going 5-for-5 a week later against Ferrum...Also averaged 38.2 yards per punt and pinned the opposition inside the 20 on 12 occasions…Launched a season-best 52-yard punt at Shenandoah…Also tallied 12 touchbacks on his kickoffs.

2011 - Freshman - Did not see action.

At Maury – A four year kicker and punter for coach Quinerly…A second team All-District selection…A first team All-District soccer player…Member of the National Honor Society…Graduated with Honors.

Personal – Mason Robert Studer was born on July 19, 1993 in Norfolk, Va…Son of Kevin and Beth Studer…Has a brother, Ethan...Favorite sports personality is Shaquille O'Neal...Dream vacation would be to backpack across Europe...Favorite movie is Lord of the Rings…Majoring in Political Science.
